<script>// Pandoc 2.9 adds attributes on both header and div. We remove the former (to
// be compatible with the behavior of Pandoc < 2.8).
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function(e) {
  var hs = document.querySelectorAll("div.section[class*='level'] > :first-child");
  var i, h, a;
  for (i = 0; i < hs.length; i++) {
    h = hs[i];
    if (!/^h[1-6]$/i.test(h.tagName)) continue;  // it should be a header h1-h6
    a = h.attributes;
    while (a.length > 0) h.removeAttribute(a[0].name);
  }
});
</script>

<script>
// apply pandoc div.sourceCode style to pre.sourceCode instead
(function() {
  var sheets = document.styleSheets;
  for (var i = 0; i < sheets.length; i++) {
    if (sheets[i].ownerNode.dataset["origin"] !== "pandoc") continue;
    try { var rules = sheets[i].cssRules; } catch (e) { continue; }
    var j = 0;
    while (j < rules.length) {
      var rule = rules[j];
      // check if there is a div.sourceCode rule
      if (rule.type !== rule.STYLE_RULE || rule.selectorText !== "div.sourceCode") {
        j++;
        continue;
      }
      var style = rule.style.cssText;
      // check if color or background-color is set
      if (rule.style.color === '' && rule.style.backgroundColor === '') {
        j++;
        continue;
      }
      // replace div.sourceCode by a pre.sourceCode rule
      sheets[i].deleteRule(j);
      sheets[i].insertRule('pre.sourceCode{' + style + '}', j);
    }
  }
})();
</script>

<body><div id="MathJax_Message" style="display: none;"></div>




<h1 class="title toc-ignore">Changing Axes</h1>



<div class="sourceCode" id="cb1"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb1-1"><a href="#cb1-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="fu">library</span>(ggplot2)</span>
<span id="cb1-2"><a href="#cb1-2" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="fu">library</span>(ggprism)</span>
<span id="cb1-3"><a href="#cb1-3" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="fu">library</span>(patchwork)</span></code></pre></div>
<p>The <a href="https://www.graphpad.com/guides/prism/latest/user-guide/frame_and_axes.htm">“Frame
and Origin”</a> tab in Prism allows you to change the appearance of the
graph’s axes. Some of these options have been implemented in
<code>ggprism</code> as axis guides. This vignette will go through how
to use the 4 axis guides included in this package.</p>
<div id="minor-ticks" class="section level2">
<h2>Minor ticks</h2>
<p>Adding minor ticks to graphs is very simple. There are two mains
ways, using the continuous scale functions such as
<code>scale_x_continuous()</code> or using the <code>guides()</code>
function, both from <code>ggplot2</code>. Note that
<code>guide_prism_minor()</code> <em>does not</em> work with discrete
axes as they do not have minor breaks.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb2"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb2-1"><a href="#cb2-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># Compare methods for adding minor ticks</span></span>
<span id="cb2-2"><a href="#cb2-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb2-3"><a href="#cb2-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_boxplot</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp))) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb2-4"><a href="#cb2-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb2-5"><a href="#cb2-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb2-6"><a href="#cb2-6" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb2-7"><a href="#cb2-7" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="fu">guide_prism_minor</span>())</span>
<span id="cb2-8"><a href="#cb2-8" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">guides</span>(<span class="at">y =</span> <span class="fu">guide_prism_minor</span>())</span>
<span id="cb2-9"><a href="#cb2-9" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb2-10"><a href="#cb2-10" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span>
<span id="cb2-11"><a href="#cb2-11" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co">#&gt; Warning: The S3 guide system was deprecated in ggplot2 3.5.0.</span></span>
<span id="cb2-12"><a href="#cb2-12" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co">#&gt; ℹ It has been replaced by a ggproto system that can be extended.</span></span>
<span id="cb2-13"><a href="#cb2-13" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co">#&gt; This warning is displayed once every 8 hours.</span></span>
<span id="cb2-14"><a href="#cb2-14" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co">#&gt; Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was</span></span>
<span id="cb2-15"><a href="#cb2-15" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co">#&gt; generated.</span></span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>Note that if you are happy with the defaults you can refer to the
axis guide as a string instead of calling the function.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb3"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb3-1"><a href="#cb3-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># refer to guide as string</span></span>
<span id="cb3-2"><a href="#cb3-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb3-3"><a href="#cb3-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_boxplot</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp))) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb3-4"><a href="#cb3-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb3-5"><a href="#cb3-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb3-6"><a href="#cb3-6" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb3-7"><a href="#cb3-7" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb3-8"><a href="#cb3-8" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">guides</span>(<span class="at">y =</span> <span class="st">"prism_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb3-9"><a href="#cb3-9" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb3-10"><a href="#cb3-10" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>To adjust the number of minor ticks, you just change the number of
minor breaks using the <code>minor_breaks</code> argument of the
continuous scale functions. The vector you give the
<code>minor_breaks</code> argument will define the position of each
minor tick.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb4"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb4-1"><a href="#cb4-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># compare 1 minor ticks (default) vs 4 minor ticks per major tick</span></span>
<span id="cb4-2"><a href="#cb4-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb4-3"><a href="#cb4-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">stat_summary</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">na.rm =</span> <span class="cn">TRUE</span>,</span>
<span id="cb4-4"><a href="#cb4-4" tabindex="-1"></a>               <span class="at">geom =</span> <span class="st">"col"</span>, <span class="at">fun =</span> mean, <span class="at">colour =</span> <span class="st">"black"</span>, <span class="at">linewidth =</span> <span class="fl">0.9</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb4-5"><a href="#cb4-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb4-6"><a href="#cb4-6" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb4-7"><a href="#cb4-7" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb4-8"><a href="#cb4-8" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_minor"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb4-9"><a href="#cb4-9" tabindex="-1"></a>                             <span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">30</span>),</span>
<span id="cb4-10"><a href="#cb4-10" tabindex="-1"></a>                             <span class="at">expand =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">0</span>))</span>
<span id="cb4-11"><a href="#cb4-11" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_minor"</span>, </span>
<span id="cb4-12"><a href="#cb4-12" tabindex="-1"></a>                             <span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">30</span>),</span>
<span id="cb4-13"><a href="#cb4-13" tabindex="-1"></a>                             <span class="at">expand =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">0</span>),</span>
<span id="cb4-14"><a href="#cb4-14" tabindex="-1"></a>                             <span class="at">minor_breaks =</span> <span class="fu">seq</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">30</span>, <span class="dv">2</span>))</span>
<span id="cb4-15"><a href="#cb4-15" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>To get log10 minor ticks, just use a log10 scale and then modify the
n <code>minor_breaks</code> argument as above. Remember the vector you
give the <code>minor_breaks</code> argument will define the position of
each minor tick.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb5"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb5-1"><a href="#cb5-1" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(msleep, <span class="fu">aes</span>(bodywt, brainwt)) <span class="sc">+</span></span>
<span id="cb5-2"><a href="#cb5-2" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_point</span>(<span class="at">na.rm =</span> <span class="cn">TRUE</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb5-3"><a href="#cb5-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>()</span>
<span id="cb5-4"><a href="#cb5-4" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb5-5"><a href="#cb5-5" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_x_log10</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="fl">1e0</span>, <span class="fl">1e4</span>),</span>
<span id="cb5-6"><a href="#cb5-6" tabindex="-1"></a>                        <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb5-7"><a href="#cb5-7" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_x_log10</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="fl">1e0</span>, <span class="fl">1e4</span>),</span>
<span id="cb5-8"><a href="#cb5-8" tabindex="-1"></a>                        <span class="at">minor_breaks =</span> <span class="fu">rep</span>(<span class="dv">1</span><span class="sc">:</span><span class="dv">9</span>, <span class="dv">4</span>)<span class="sc">*</span>(<span class="dv">10</span><span class="sc">^</span><span class="fu">rep</span>(<span class="dv">0</span><span class="sc">:</span><span class="dv">3</span>, <span class="at">each =</span> <span class="dv">9</span>)),</span>
<span id="cb5-9"><a href="#cb5-9" tabindex="-1"></a>                        <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb5-10"><a href="#cb5-10" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>You can use the <code>theme()</code> function with the
<code>prism.ticks.length</code> argument to change the length of the
minor ticks. This works in the same way as the
<code>axis.ticks.length</code> argument to change the length of major
ticks.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb6"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb6-1"><a href="#cb6-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># change minor tick length</span></span>
<span id="cb6-2"><a href="#cb6-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb6-3"><a href="#cb6-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">stat_summary</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">na.rm =</span> <span class="cn">TRUE</span>,</span>
<span id="cb6-4"><a href="#cb6-4" tabindex="-1"></a>               <span class="at">geom =</span> <span class="st">"col"</span>, <span class="at">fun =</span> mean, <span class="at">colour =</span> <span class="st">"black"</span>, <span class="at">linewidth =</span> <span class="fl">0.9</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb6-5"><a href="#cb6-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb6-6"><a href="#cb6-6" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_minor"</span>, </span>
<span id="cb6-7"><a href="#cb6-7" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">30</span>),</span>
<span id="cb6-8"><a href="#cb6-8" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">expand =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">0</span>),</span>
<span id="cb6-9"><a href="#cb6-9" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">minor_breaks =</span> <span class="fu">seq</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">30</span>, <span class="dv">2</span>))</span>
<span id="cb6-10"><a href="#cb6-10" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb6-11"><a href="#cb6-11" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb6-12"><a href="#cb6-12" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb6-13"><a href="#cb6-13" tabindex="-1"></a>                <span class="at">prism.ticks.length.y =</span> <span class="fu">unit</span>(<span class="dv">20</span>, <span class="st">"pt"</span>))</span>
<span id="cb6-14"><a href="#cb6-14" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb6-15"><a href="#cb6-15" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>You can change the direction of minor ticks just by making their
length negative.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb7"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb7-1"><a href="#cb7-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># change minor tick length</span></span>
<span id="cb7-2"><a href="#cb7-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb7-3"><a href="#cb7-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">stat_summary</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">na.rm =</span> <span class="cn">TRUE</span>,</span>
<span id="cb7-4"><a href="#cb7-4" tabindex="-1"></a>               <span class="at">geom =</span> <span class="st">"col"</span>, <span class="at">fun =</span> mean, <span class="at">colour =</span> <span class="st">"black"</span>, <span class="at">linewidth =</span> <span class="fl">0.9</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb7-5"><a href="#cb7-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb7-6"><a href="#cb7-6" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_minor"</span>, </span>
<span id="cb7-7"><a href="#cb7-7" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">30</span>),</span>
<span id="cb7-8"><a href="#cb7-8" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">expand =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">0</span>),</span>
<span id="cb7-9"><a href="#cb7-9" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">minor_breaks =</span> <span class="fu">seq</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">30</span>, <span class="dv">2</span>))</span>
<span id="cb7-10"><a href="#cb7-10" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb7-11"><a href="#cb7-11" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb7-12"><a href="#cb7-12" tabindex="-1"></a>                <span class="at">prism.ticks.length.y =</span> <span class="fu">unit</span>(<span class="dv">20</span>, <span class="st">"pt"</span>))</span>
<span id="cb7-13"><a href="#cb7-13" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb7-14"><a href="#cb7-14" tabindex="-1"></a>                <span class="at">prism.ticks.length.y =</span> <span class="fu">unit</span>(<span class="sc">-</span><span class="dv">20</span>, <span class="st">"pt"</span>))</span>
<span id="cb7-15"><a href="#cb7-15" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb7-16"><a href="#cb7-16" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>The colour (and other aesthetic attributes) of minor ticks will
change when you change the colour of major ticks using the
<code>axis.ticks</code> argument of the <code>theme()</code>
function.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb8"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb8-1"><a href="#cb8-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># change how ticks look</span></span>
<span id="cb8-2"><a href="#cb8-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb8-3"><a href="#cb8-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">stat_summary</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">na.rm =</span> <span class="cn">TRUE</span>,</span>
<span id="cb8-4"><a href="#cb8-4" tabindex="-1"></a>               <span class="at">geom =</span> <span class="st">"col"</span>, <span class="at">fun =</span> mean, <span class="at">colour =</span> <span class="st">"black"</span>, <span class="at">linewidth =</span> <span class="fl">0.9</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb8-5"><a href="#cb8-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb8-6"><a href="#cb8-6" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_minor"</span>, </span>
<span id="cb8-7"><a href="#cb8-7" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">30</span>),</span>
<span id="cb8-8"><a href="#cb8-8" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">expand =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">0</span>),</span>
<span id="cb8-9"><a href="#cb8-9" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">minor_breaks =</span> <span class="fu">seq</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">30</span>, <span class="dv">2</span>))</span>
<span id="cb8-10"><a href="#cb8-10" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb8-11"><a href="#cb8-11" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb8-12"><a href="#cb8-12" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb8-13"><a href="#cb8-13" tabindex="-1"></a>                <span class="at">axis.ticks.y =</span> <span class="fu">element_line</span>(<span class="at">colour =</span> <span class="st">"blue"</span>, </span>
<span id="cb8-14"><a href="#cb8-14" tabindex="-1"></a>                                            <span class="at">linewidth =</span> <span class="dv">2</span>, </span>
<span id="cb8-15"><a href="#cb8-15" tabindex="-1"></a>                                            <span class="at">lineend =</span> <span class="st">"round"</span>))</span>
<span id="cb8-16"><a href="#cb8-16" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb8-17"><a href="#cb8-17" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
</div>
<div id="offset-axis" class="section level2">
<h2>Offset axis</h2>
<p>One popular axis option in Prism is the offset axis. This has been
implemented in <code>ggprism</code> as the
<code>guide_prism_offset()</code> function. This function works by only
drawing the axis line to the outer most tick mark (either major or minor
tick). Technically, it works with both continuous and discrete scales,
but it should probably only be used with continuous scales.</p>
<p>If you want an offset axis with minor ticks, see the
<code>guide_prism_offset_minor()</code> function below.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb9"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb9-1"><a href="#cb9-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># show that offset axis looks better when you specify the axis limits</span></span>
<span id="cb9-2"><a href="#cb9-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb9-3"><a href="#cb9-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_boxplot</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp))) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb9-4"><a href="#cb9-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb9-5"><a href="#cb9-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb9-6"><a href="#cb9-6" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb9-7"><a href="#cb9-7" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb9-8"><a href="#cb9-8" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb9-9"><a href="#cb9-9" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb9-10"><a href="#cb9-10" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>As with a normal ggplot, you can adjust the appearance of the offset
axis line with the <code>theme()</code> function and the
<code>axis.line</code> argument.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb10"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb10-1"><a href="#cb10-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># change appearance of offset axis</span></span>
<span id="cb10-2"><a href="#cb10-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb10-3"><a href="#cb10-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_boxplot</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp))) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb10-4"><a href="#cb10-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb10-5"><a href="#cb10-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb10-6"><a href="#cb10-6" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb10-7"><a href="#cb10-7" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb10-8"><a href="#cb10-8" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb10-9"><a href="#cb10-9" tabindex="-1"></a>                <span class="at">axis.line.y =</span> <span class="fu">element_line</span>(<span class="at">colour =</span> <span class="st">"blue"</span>, </span>
<span id="cb10-10"><a href="#cb10-10" tabindex="-1"></a>                                           <span class="at">linewidth =</span> <span class="dv">2</span>, </span>
<span id="cb10-11"><a href="#cb10-11" tabindex="-1"></a>                                           <span class="at">lineend =</span> <span class="st">"round"</span>))</span>
<span id="cb10-12"><a href="#cb10-12" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb10-13"><a href="#cb10-13" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
</div>
<div id="offset-axis-with-minor-ticks" class="section level2">
<h2>Offset axis with minor ticks</h2>
<p>The <code>guide_prism_offset_minor()</code> function is similar to
<code>guide_prism_minor()</code> except the axis line is offset.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb11"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb11-1"><a href="#cb11-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># compare prism_minor with prism_offset_minor</span></span>
<span id="cb11-2"><a href="#cb11-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb11-3"><a href="#cb11-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_boxplot</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp))) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb11-4"><a href="#cb11-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb11-5"><a href="#cb11-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb11-6"><a href="#cb11-6" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb11-7"><a href="#cb11-7" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb11-8"><a href="#cb11-8" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb11-9"><a href="#cb11-9" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb11-10"><a href="#cb11-10" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>As with <code>guide_prism_offset()</code>, the axis tends to look
better if you explicitly set the axis limits.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb12"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb12-1"><a href="#cb12-1" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb12-2"><a href="#cb12-2" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_boxplot</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp))) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb12-3"><a href="#cb12-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb12-4"><a href="#cb12-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb12-5"><a href="#cb12-5" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb12-6"><a href="#cb12-6" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb12-7"><a href="#cb12-7" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), </span>
<span id="cb12-8"><a href="#cb12-8" tabindex="-1"></a>                             <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb12-9"><a href="#cb12-9" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb12-10"><a href="#cb12-10" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>As with <code>guide_prism_minor()</code> you can change the number of
minor ticks by adjusting the <code>minor_breaks</code>.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb13"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb13-1"><a href="#cb13-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># compare 1 minor tick to 4 minor ticks per major</span></span>
<span id="cb13-2"><a href="#cb13-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb13-3"><a href="#cb13-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_boxplot</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp))) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb13-4"><a href="#cb13-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb13-5"><a href="#cb13-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb13-6"><a href="#cb13-6" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb13-7"><a href="#cb13-7" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), </span>
<span id="cb13-8"><a href="#cb13-8" tabindex="-1"></a>                             <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb13-9"><a href="#cb13-9" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), </span>
<span id="cb13-10"><a href="#cb13-10" tabindex="-1"></a>                             <span class="at">minor_breaks =</span> <span class="fu">seq</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>, <span class="dv">2</span>),</span>
<span id="cb13-11"><a href="#cb13-11" tabindex="-1"></a>                             <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb13-12"><a href="#cb13-12" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb13-13"><a href="#cb13-13" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>And as with <code>guide_prism_minor()</code> you can change the
length of minor ticks by adjusting the <code>prism_ticks_length</code>
argument of the <code>theme()</code> function.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb14"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb14-1"><a href="#cb14-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># change minor tick length and direction</span></span>
<span id="cb14-2"><a href="#cb14-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb14-3"><a href="#cb14-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_boxplot</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp))) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb14-4"><a href="#cb14-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb14-5"><a href="#cb14-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), </span>
<span id="cb14-6"><a href="#cb14-6" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">minor_breaks =</span> <span class="fu">seq</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>, <span class="dv">2</span>),</span>
<span id="cb14-7"><a href="#cb14-7" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb14-8"><a href="#cb14-8" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb14-9"><a href="#cb14-9" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb14-10"><a href="#cb14-10" tabindex="-1"></a>                <span class="at">prism.ticks.length.y =</span> <span class="fu">unit</span>(<span class="dv">20</span>, <span class="st">"pt"</span>))</span>
<span id="cb14-11"><a href="#cb14-11" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb14-12"><a href="#cb14-12" tabindex="-1"></a>                <span class="at">prism.ticks.length.y =</span> <span class="fu">unit</span>(<span class="sc">-</span><span class="dv">20</span>, <span class="st">"pt"</span>))</span>
<span id="cb14-13"><a href="#cb14-13" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb14-14"><a href="#cb14-14" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>Lastly, the colour (and other aesthetic attributes) of minor ticks
will change when you change the colour of major ticks using the
<code>axis.ticks</code> argument of the <code>theme()</code>
function.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb15"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb15-1"><a href="#cb15-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># change minor tick colour, thickness, and lineend</span></span>
<span id="cb15-2"><a href="#cb15-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb15-3"><a href="#cb15-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_boxplot</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">fill =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(supp))) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb15-4"><a href="#cb15-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb15-5"><a href="#cb15-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), </span>
<span id="cb15-6"><a href="#cb15-6" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">minor_breaks =</span> <span class="fu">seq</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>, <span class="dv">2</span>),</span>
<span id="cb15-7"><a href="#cb15-7" tabindex="-1"></a>                     <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb15-8"><a href="#cb15-8" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb15-9"><a href="#cb15-9" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb15-10"><a href="#cb15-10" tabindex="-1"></a>                <span class="at">prism.ticks.length.y =</span> <span class="fu">unit</span>(<span class="dv">20</span>, <span class="st">"pt"</span>))</span>
<span id="cb15-11"><a href="#cb15-11" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb15-12"><a href="#cb15-12" tabindex="-1"></a>                <span class="at">prism.ticks.length.y =</span> <span class="fu">unit</span>(<span class="dv">20</span>, <span class="st">"pt"</span>),</span>
<span id="cb15-13"><a href="#cb15-13" tabindex="-1"></a>                <span class="at">axis.ticks.y =</span> <span class="fu">element_line</span>(<span class="at">colour =</span> <span class="st">"blue"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb15-14"><a href="#cb15-14" tabindex="-1"></a>                                            <span class="at">linewidth =</span> <span class="dv">2</span>,</span>
<span id="cb15-15"><a href="#cb15-15" tabindex="-1"></a>                                            <span class="at">lineend =</span> <span class="st">"round"</span>))</span>
<span id="cb15-16"><a href="#cb15-16" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb15-17"><a href="#cb15-17" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
</div>
<div id="brackets-axis" class="section level2">
<h2>Brackets axis</h2>
<p>Brackets are not an axis option in GraphPad Prism. Rather the idea
comes from the <a href="https://github.com/stefanedwards/lemon"><code>lemon</code></a>
package functions <code>brackets_horisontal()</code> and
<code>brackets_vertical()</code>. I wanted brackets for my graphs,
therefore they have been re-implemented in <code>ggprism</code> as the
<code>guide_prism_brackets()</code> axis guide.</p>
<p>This axis guide works best with discrete axes.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb16"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb16-1"><a href="#cb16-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># show bracket axis guide</span></span>
<span id="cb16-2"><a href="#cb16-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb16-3"><a href="#cb16-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_jitter</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">shape =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">width =</span> <span class="fl">0.2</span>, <span class="at">size =</span> <span class="dv">2</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb16-4"><a href="#cb16-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_shape_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb16-5"><a href="#cb16-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb16-6"><a href="#cb16-6" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb16-7"><a href="#cb16-7" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb16-8"><a href="#cb16-8" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb16-9"><a href="#cb16-9" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p1 <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_x_discrete</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_bracket"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb16-10"><a href="#cb16-10" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb16-11"><a href="#cb16-11" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>The guide works fine with flipped plots.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb17"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb17-1"><a href="#cb17-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># show bracket axis guide with flipped plot</span></span>
<span id="cb17-2"><a href="#cb17-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb17-3"><a href="#cb17-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_jitter</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">shape =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">width =</span> <span class="fl">0.2</span>, <span class="at">size =</span> <span class="dv">2</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb17-4"><a href="#cb17-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_shape_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb17-5"><a href="#cb17-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb17-6"><a href="#cb17-6" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb17-7"><a href="#cb17-7" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset"</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb17-8"><a href="#cb17-8" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_x_discrete</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_bracket"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb17-9"><a href="#cb17-9" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb17-10"><a href="#cb17-10" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p1 <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">coord_flip</span>()</span>
<span id="cb17-11"><a href="#cb17-11" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb17-12"><a href="#cb17-12" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>By default, the function tries to guess how wide the brackets should
be. However you can control the bracket width with the
<code>width</code> argument. Try numbers between 0 and 1. In this
example we make the width of <code>geom_jitter()</code> and the width of
<code>guide_prism_bracket()</code> both 0.2 which seems to work
well.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb18"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb18-1"><a href="#cb18-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># control bracket width</span></span>
<span id="cb18-2"><a href="#cb18-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb18-3"><a href="#cb18-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_jitter</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">shape =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">width =</span> <span class="fl">0.2</span>, <span class="at">size =</span> <span class="dv">2</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb18-4"><a href="#cb18-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_shape_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb18-5"><a href="#cb18-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb18-6"><a href="#cb18-6" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb18-7"><a href="#cb18-7" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb18-8"><a href="#cb18-8" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb18-9"><a href="#cb18-9" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_x_discrete</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_bracket"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb18-10"><a href="#cb18-10" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_x_discrete</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="fu">guide_prism_bracket</span>(<span class="at">width =</span> <span class="fl">0.2</span>))</span>
<span id="cb18-11"><a href="#cb18-11" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb18-12"><a href="#cb18-12" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>You can change the bracket direction with the <code>outside</code>
argument. By default, <code>outside = TRUE</code> which means the
brackets point outward.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb19"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb19-1"><a href="#cb19-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># compare brackets outside or inside</span></span>
<span id="cb19-2"><a href="#cb19-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb19-3"><a href="#cb19-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_jitter</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">shape =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">width =</span> <span class="fl">0.2</span>, <span class="at">size =</span> <span class="dv">2</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb19-4"><a href="#cb19-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_shape_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb19-5"><a href="#cb19-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb19-6"><a href="#cb19-6" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb19-7"><a href="#cb19-7" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb19-8"><a href="#cb19-8" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb19-9"><a href="#cb19-9" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_x_discrete</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_bracket"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb19-10"><a href="#cb19-10" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_x_discrete</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="fu">guide_prism_bracket</span>(<span class="at">outside =</span> <span class="cn">FALSE</span>))</span>
<span id="cb19-11"><a href="#cb19-11" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb19-12"><a href="#cb19-12" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>Making the brackets point inside makes the space between the axis
text and the brackets smaller. You can increase this distance again by
changing the margin of the relevent <code>axis.text</code> element.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb20"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb20-1"><a href="#cb20-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># adjust text spacing with inside pointing brackets</span></span>
<span id="cb20-2"><a href="#cb20-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(ToothGrowth, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb20-3"><a href="#cb20-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_jitter</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">shape =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">width =</span> <span class="fl">0.2</span>, <span class="at">size =</span> <span class="dv">2</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb20-4"><a href="#cb20-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_shape_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb20-5"><a href="#cb20-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb20-6"><a href="#cb20-6" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">limits =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">40</span>), <span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset"</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb20-7"><a href="#cb20-7" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_x_discrete</span>(<span class="at">guide =</span> <span class="fu">guide_prism_bracket</span>(<span class="at">outside =</span> <span class="cn">FALSE</span>))</span>
<span id="cb20-8"><a href="#cb20-8" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb20-9"><a href="#cb20-9" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb20-10"><a href="#cb20-10" tabindex="-1"></a>p2 <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb20-11"><a href="#cb20-11" tabindex="-1"></a>                <span class="at">axis.text.x =</span> <span class="fu">element_text</span>(<span class="at">margin =</span> <span class="fu">margin</span>(<span class="at">t =</span> <span class="dv">10</span>)))</span>
<span id="cb20-12"><a href="#cb20-12" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb20-13"><a href="#cb20-13" tabindex="-1"></a>p1 <span class="sc">+</span> p2</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
</div>
<div id="border-with-minor-ticks" class="section level2">
<h2>Border with minor ticks</h2>
<p>Say you want a graph, with a border, and with minor ticks. There are
a couple of ways one might do this, one of which is outlined here. The
other way involved messing around with secondary axes and is buggy so
we’ll ignore it for now.</p>
<p>First we define a base plot.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb21"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb21-1"><a href="#cb21-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># define a base plot</span></span>
<span id="cb21-2"><a href="#cb21-2" tabindex="-1"></a>base <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(mpg, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> displ, <span class="at">y =</span> cty)) <span class="sc">+</span></span>
<span id="cb21-3"><a href="#cb21-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_point</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">colour =</span> class))</span>
<span id="cb21-4"><a href="#cb21-4" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb21-5"><a href="#cb21-5" tabindex="-1"></a>base</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>Then we’ll apply <code>theme_prism()</code> with a border, move the
legend into the plotting area, and turn clipping off so the border
thickness is accurate.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb22"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb22-1"><a href="#cb22-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># apply theme_prism and turn clipping off for the border</span></span>
<span id="cb22-2"><a href="#cb22-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> base <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>(<span class="at">border =</span> <span class="cn">TRUE</span>) <span class="sc">+</span></span>
<span id="cb22-3"><a href="#cb22-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">guides</span>(<span class="at">colour =</span> <span class="fu">guide_legend</span>(<span class="at">position =</span> <span class="st">"inside"</span>)) <span class="sc">+</span></span>
<span id="cb22-4"><a href="#cb22-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position.inside =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="fl">0.8</span>, <span class="fl">0.75</span>)) <span class="sc">+</span></span>
<span id="cb22-5"><a href="#cb22-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">coord_cartesian</span>(<span class="at">clip =</span> <span class="st">"off"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb22-6"><a href="#cb22-6" tabindex="-1"></a>p</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>Now we’ll add minor ticks to both primary axes.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb23"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb23-1"><a href="#cb23-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># add axis guides</span></span>
<span id="cb23-2"><a href="#cb23-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">guides</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="st">"prism_minor"</span>, <span class="at">y =</span> <span class="st">"prism_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb23-3"><a href="#cb23-3" tabindex="-1"></a>p</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>One way to add minor ticks all around the border is to use the
<code>annotation_ticks()</code> function in <code>ggprism</code>. This
is the way I would recommend to avoid the issues that arise using
secondary axes.</p>
<p>Here we add ticks as a plot annotation (i.e.&nbsp;not a proper axis) with
the following arguments:</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: decimal">
<li>Put the ticks on the top and right sides</li>
<li>Draw both major and minor ticks (as opposed to just
<code>"minor"</code> or <code>"major"</code>)</li>
<li>Make the thickness = 1</li>
<li>Make them point outside (must turn clipping off!)</li>
<li>Try to match the lengths with the other tick marks (bit of trial and
error)</li>
</ol>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb24"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb24-1"><a href="#cb24-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># add tick annotations</span></span>
<span id="cb24-2"><a href="#cb24-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p_annot <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">annotation_ticks</span>(<span class="at">sides =</span> <span class="st">"tr"</span>, <span class="at">type =</span> <span class="st">"both"</span>, <span class="at">linewidth =</span> <span class="dv">1</span>,</span>
<span id="cb24-3"><a href="#cb24-3" tabindex="-1"></a>                                <span class="at">outside =</span> <span class="cn">TRUE</span>,</span>
<span id="cb24-4"><a href="#cb24-4" tabindex="-1"></a>                                <span class="at">tick.length =</span> <span class="fu">unit</span>(<span class="dv">14</span><span class="sc">/</span><span class="dv">2</span>, <span class="st">"pt"</span>),</span>
<span id="cb24-5"><a href="#cb24-5" tabindex="-1"></a>                                <span class="at">minor.length =</span> <span class="fu">unit</span>(<span class="dv">14</span><span class="sc">/</span><span class="dv">4</span>, <span class="st">"pt"</span>))</span>
<span id="cb24-6"><a href="#cb24-6" tabindex="-1"></a>p_annot</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>You can adjust the number of minor ticks using the continuous scale
functions as before.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb25"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb25-1"><a href="#cb25-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># tick annotations will mirror adjustments to the actual axis ticks</span></span>
<span id="cb25-2"><a href="#cb25-2" tabindex="-1"></a>p_annot <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p_annot <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale_x_continuous</span>(<span class="at">minor_breaks =</span> <span class="fu">seq</span>(<span class="dv">1</span>, <span class="dv">7</span>, <span class="fl">0.2</span>))</span>
<span id="cb25-3"><a href="#cb25-3" tabindex="-1"></a>p_annot</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
</div>
<div id="discontinuous-axis" class="section level2">
<h2>Discontinuous axis</h2>
<p>Generally using discontinuous axes is discouraged. However as it is
an option in GraphPad Prism, an example of how to do this with
<code>ggprism</code> is given below.</p>
<p>First we’ll take the <code>ToothGrowth</code> data set and change a
value in the <code>len</code> column to be an obvious outlier.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb26"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb26-1"><a href="#cb26-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># multiply one of the len values by 100</span></span>
<span id="cb26-2"><a href="#cb26-2" tabindex="-1"></a>tg <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> ToothGrowth</span>
<span id="cb26-3"><a href="#cb26-3" tabindex="-1"></a>tg[<span class="dv">2</span>, <span class="st">"len"</span>] <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> tg[<span class="dv">2</span>, <span class="st">"len"</span>] <span class="sc">*</span> <span class="dv">100</span></span></code></pre></div>
<p>Next we’ll see what a plot without a discontinuous axis would look
like. The majority of the data has been compressed near the bottom of
the plot in an attempt to fit the outlier point. In this situation one
might want to use a discontinuous axis (although honestly it is probably
better to add an inset plot using the <code>patchwork</code>
package).</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb27"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb27-1"><a href="#cb27-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="fu">ggplot</span>(tg, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb27-2"><a href="#cb27-2" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_jitter</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">shape =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">width =</span> <span class="fl">0.2</span>, <span class="at">size =</span> <span class="dv">2</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb27-3"><a href="#cb27-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_shape_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb27-4"><a href="#cb27-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb27-5"><a href="#cb27-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>We’ll use the <code>patchwork</code> package to create our
discontinuous axis plot. Indeed, we will be making two plots (one zoomed
in on the main data and the other zoomed in on the outlier), using a
slightly different theme for each plot, and then combining them.</p>
<p>First we’ll make a plot zoomed in on the main data. It is important
to use <code>coord_cartesian()</code> to change the axis limits instead
of <code>scale_y_continuous()</code> as <code>coord_cartesian()</code>
does not exclude any data, unlike <code>scale_y_continuous()</code>.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb28"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb28-1"><a href="#cb28-1" tabindex="-1"></a>p_bottom <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(tg, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb28-2"><a href="#cb28-2" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_jitter</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">shape =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">width =</span> <span class="fl">0.2</span>, <span class="at">size =</span> <span class="dv">2</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb28-3"><a href="#cb28-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_shape_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb28-4"><a href="#cb28-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">coord_cartesian</span>(<span class="at">ylim =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">0</span>, <span class="dv">60</span>)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb28-5"><a href="#cb28-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">guides</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="st">"prism_bracket"</span>, <span class="at">y =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset_minor"</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb28-6"><a href="#cb28-6" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb28-7"><a href="#cb28-7" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb28-8"><a href="#cb28-8" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb28-9"><a href="#cb28-9" tabindex="-1"></a>p_bottom</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>Next we’ll make a plot zoomed in on the outlier, and we’ll make a new
theme for the top plot specifically, called
<code>theme_outlier()</code>.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb29"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb29-1"><a href="#cb29-1" tabindex="-1"></a>p_top <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="fu">ggplot</span>(tg, <span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">x =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose), <span class="at">y =</span> len)) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb29-2"><a href="#cb29-2" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">geom_jitter</span>(<span class="fu">aes</span>(<span class="at">shape =</span> <span class="fu">factor</span>(dose)), <span class="at">width =</span> <span class="fl">0.2</span>, <span class="at">size =</span> <span class="dv">2</span>) <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb29-3"><a href="#cb29-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_shape_prism</span>() <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb29-4"><a href="#cb29-4" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">coord_cartesian</span>(<span class="at">ylim =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">1140</span>, <span class="dv">1160</span>)) <span class="sc">+</span></span>
<span id="cb29-5"><a href="#cb29-5" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">scale_y_continuous</span>(<span class="at">breaks =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">1140</span>, <span class="dv">1160</span>)) <span class="sc">+</span></span>
<span id="cb29-6"><a href="#cb29-6" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">guides</span>(<span class="at">y =</span> <span class="st">"prism_offset_minor"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb29-7"><a href="#cb29-7" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb29-8"><a href="#cb29-8" tabindex="-1"></a>theme_outlier <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> <span class="cf">function</span>(<span class="at">palette =</span> <span class="st">"black_and_white"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb29-9"><a href="#cb29-9" tabindex="-1"></a>                          <span class="at">base_size =</span> <span class="dv">14</span>,</span>
<span id="cb29-10"><a href="#cb29-10" tabindex="-1"></a>                          <span class="at">base_family =</span> <span class="st">"sans"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb29-11"><a href="#cb29-11" tabindex="-1"></a>                          <span class="at">base_fontface =</span> <span class="st">"bold"</span>,</span>
<span id="cb29-12"><a href="#cb29-12" tabindex="-1"></a>                          <span class="at">base_line_size =</span> base_size<span class="sc">/</span><span class="dv">14</span>,</span>
<span id="cb29-13"><a href="#cb29-13" tabindex="-1"></a>                          <span class="at">base_rect_size =</span> base_size<span class="sc">/</span><span class="dv">14</span>,</span>
<span id="cb29-14"><a href="#cb29-14" tabindex="-1"></a>                          <span class="at">axis_text_angle =</span> <span class="dv">0</span>,</span>
<span id="cb29-15"><a href="#cb29-15" tabindex="-1"></a>                          <span class="at">border =</span> <span class="cn">FALSE</span>) {</span>
<span id="cb29-16"><a href="#cb29-16" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme_prism</span>(<span class="at">palette =</span> palette,</span>
<span id="cb29-17"><a href="#cb29-17" tabindex="-1"></a>              <span class="at">base_size =</span> base_size,</span>
<span id="cb29-18"><a href="#cb29-18" tabindex="-1"></a>              <span class="at">base_family =</span> base_family,</span>
<span id="cb29-19"><a href="#cb29-19" tabindex="-1"></a>              <span class="at">base_fontface =</span> base_fontface,</span>
<span id="cb29-20"><a href="#cb29-20" tabindex="-1"></a>              <span class="at">base_line_size =</span> base_line_size,</span>
<span id="cb29-21"><a href="#cb29-21" tabindex="-1"></a>              <span class="at">base_rect_size =</span> base_rect_size,</span>
<span id="cb29-22"><a href="#cb29-22" tabindex="-1"></a>              <span class="at">axis_text_angle =</span> axis_text_angle,</span>
<span id="cb29-23"><a href="#cb29-23" tabindex="-1"></a>              <span class="at">border =</span> border) <span class="sc">%+replace%</span> </span>
<span id="cb29-24"><a href="#cb29-24" tabindex="-1"></a>    <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">axis.title =</span> <span class="fu">element_blank</span>(),</span>
<span id="cb29-25"><a href="#cb29-25" tabindex="-1"></a>          <span class="at">axis.text.x =</span> <span class="fu">element_blank</span>(),</span>
<span id="cb29-26"><a href="#cb29-26" tabindex="-1"></a>          <span class="at">axis.ticks.x =</span> <span class="fu">element_blank</span>(),</span>
<span id="cb29-27"><a href="#cb29-27" tabindex="-1"></a>          <span class="at">axis.line.x =</span> <span class="fu">element_blank</span>(),</span>
<span id="cb29-28"><a href="#cb29-28" tabindex="-1"></a>          <span class="at">legend.position =</span> <span class="st">"none"</span>)</span>
<span id="cb29-29"><a href="#cb29-29" tabindex="-1"></a>}</span>
<span id="cb29-30"><a href="#cb29-30" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
<span id="cb29-31"><a href="#cb29-31" tabindex="-1"></a>p_top <span class="ot">&lt;-</span> p_top <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">theme_outlier</span>()</span>
<span id="cb29-32"><a href="#cb29-32" tabindex="-1"></a>p_top</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
<p>Now we’ll combine the two plots with <code>patchwork</code>. We can
easily change theme elements of both plots using
<code>&amp; theme()</code>.</p>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb30"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb30-1"><a href="#cb30-1" tabindex="-1"></a>p_top <span class="sc">/</span> p_bottom <span class="sc">+</span> </span>
<span id="cb30-2"><a href="#cb30-2" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">plot_layout</span>(<span class="at">heights =</span> <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">1</span>, <span class="dv">4</span>)) <span class="sc">&amp;</span> </span>
<span id="cb30-3"><a href="#cb30-3" tabindex="-1"></a>  <span class="fu">theme</span>(<span class="at">axis.text.y =</span> <span class="fu">element_text</span>(<span class="at">colour =</span> <span class="st">"red"</span>))</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64,"><!-- --></p>
</div>
